intro: Micromeria glomerata, commonly known as clustered micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the citrus family, Rutaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are generally small, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and the plant produces small, round fruits that are edible but not commonly cultivated.
